column3: pron. {{IPA|[aˈtanatar]}}) is a [[Quenya]] term which means "Fathers of [[Men]]"
column4: and is used to describe the forefathers of the [[Edain]].<ref>{{S|Men}}</ref>

column1: Its use is not exactly clear: sometimes it is used to refer to the [[Edain]] of the [[First Age]]
column2: other times it is only applied to [[Bëor]]
column4: and in yet other places it is used to refer to those peoples the [[Edain]] are descended from.

column1: If the third meaning is adopted
column2: it can be said that the so-called [[Middle Men]] of [[Middle-earth]] (the [[Rohirrim]]
column4: etc.) are also descendants from the ''Atanatári''

column1: The [[Sindarin]] form of the word is '''[[Edenedair]]''' (pron. {{IPA|[eˈdeneda͡ɪr]}})
